title: Mass. man whose dog died in fireworks explosion to face charges
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Kevin Ruiz, 54, of Dartmouth, will face multiple charges after a dog died in a house explosion on Sept.
A Dartmouth man is facing charges after a dog was killed in a house explosion and fire believed to be caused by fireworks.

title: 2 separate kitten incidents prompt warning for drivers to check under the hood
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The baby kittens, named Sparky and Pisces, were recently found seeking warmth under the hoods of cars located in Taunton and Brockton.
A 5-month-old male kitten, named Pisces, was found in a car engine in Brockton.

title: Mass. health officials announce additional human cases of West Nile virus
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The risk of West Nile virus is now high in 47 communities across Suffolk, Middlesex, Essex, and Worcester counties.
Mosquitoes are trapped and tested for viruses, included West Nile Virus.

title: How eggplant and peach sculptures are starting controversy
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters An artist's suggestive sculptures are causing debate in Ellicott City, Maryland, and are raising questions about permits.
Late day sun hits the peach orchards at White Gate Farm in Dracut, MA on September 03, 2021.

title: Here’s what Alex Cora, Craig Breslow said after Red Sox playoff-clinching win
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox “Because at every challenge, they’ve shown that resilience and the ability to overcome it.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez questionable to play, make season debut vs. Panthers
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez (hamstring) returned to practice last week, but head coach Mike Vrabel ultimately made the decision to keep him out of Week 3’s matchup with the Steelers.
If Christian Gonzalez returns from injury on Sunday, his presence should aid the Patriots' struggling passing defense.
John Tlumacki/Globe Staff MORE PATRIOTS The 1-2 Patriots could be getting some major defensive help in Sunday’s contest against the Carolina Panthers.

title: Harvard student orchestra suspended over hazing allegations
author: Abby Patkin

title: Patriots won’t discipline Rhamondre Stevenson for fumbling issue
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "The discipline is we need our best players to play in a game and do their job and take care of football.
" Rhamondre Stevenson lost two fumbles in the Patriots' loss to the Steelers.

Barry Chin/Globe Staff By Conor Roche September 26, 2025 | 4:10 PM 2 minutes to read When the Patriots’ offense first takes the field against the Panthers on Sunday, don’t be surprised if you see Rhamondre Stevenson among that group.
